solution.text:
Rate of flow : _{k}_ \(\frac {litre}{min}\)
Initial Temp \(T_1\) = _{temp1}_\(^\circ\)C
Final Temp \(T_2\) = _{temp2}_\(^\circ\)C

\(\Delta T = T_2 - T_1 = _{temp2}_ - _{temp1}_ = _{{temp2 - temp1}}_^\circ C\)

Mass of water flowing through the pipe per min (m) = \(_{k}_ \frac {litre}{min} = _{{k*1000}}_ \frac {g}{min}\)
Specific Heat of water (c) = 4.2 \(\frac {J}{g\;C}\)
Therefore, total heat required = \(\Delta Q = m \times c \times \Delta T = _{{k*1000}}_ \times 4.2 \times _{{temp2 - temp1}}_\)
\(= _{{k*1000 * 4.2 * (temp2 - temp1)}}_ \frac{J}{min}\)

Rate of gas required \(= \frac {_{{k*1000 * 4.2 * (temp2 - temp1)}}_}{_{heat}_ \times 10^4} = _{{trunc(Decimal(k*0.1 * 4.2 * (temp2 - temp1)/heat),2)}}_ \frac {g}{min}\)

content.text: A water heater warms water flowing through a conductive pipe at the rate of _{k}_ litres per minute from _{temp1}_\(^\circ \)C to _{temp2}_\(^ \circ \)C. The heater operates on a gas burner, with a heat of combustion of _{heat}_\( \times 10^4 \;\frac {J}{g}\). At what rate is the gas consumed?
